title: Add URL pagination to episode grid
description:
Update the pagination component to use URL query parameters (e.g., ?page=2) instead of client-side only state. This allows:
- Direct linking to specific pages
- Browser back/forward navigation between pages
- SEO benefits for crawling paginated content
- Bookmarking specific pages

Implementation:
- Use useRoute() to read current page from query params
- Use navigateTo() or router.push() to update URL when page changes
- Maintain existing pagination UI and functionality
- Handle edge cases (invalid page numbers, out of range)

title: Generate site theme colors from podcast artwork
description: Extract dominant colors from the podcast's main artwork image and use them to generate a cohesive site color palette. At minimum: primary/accent color for buttons, links, and active states. Stretch: tint the background and text colors in both light and dark mode with a subtle hue from the extracted palette for a more sophisticated feel. Approach options: server-side extraction at build/cache time using sharp or canvas, or client-side with a canvas element. Output should set CSS custom properties that override oat.css defaults (--primary, --accent, --background, --foreground, etc.). Research color extraction libraries (e.g. node-vibrant, colorthief, color.js, culori, extract-colors) and pick the one that gives the best results for generating usable palettes from podcast artwork - needs to handle vibrant vs muted tones, ensure sufficient contrast ratios for accessibility, and produce both light and dark mode variants.
close_reason: Initial implementation complete - artwork color extraction with accessible palettes, subscribe button redesign with brand icons. Pending user review for refinements.
